message.content:
cs.NA, cs.DC, cs.SC, cs.MS, cs.CE 

The paper deals with algorithms for particle management in a particle-in-cell code, which is commonly used in computational physics and engineering. The paper discusses the use of dynamically adaptive Cartesian grids and multiscale grid representations, which are techniques commonly used in numerical analysis and scientific computing. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.NA (Numerical Analysis). The paper also discusses data movement prediction schemes, which are relevant to distributed computing and parallel algorithms, suggesting that cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) is also a likely sub-category. The use of space-filling curves and linked cells suggests that cs.SC (Symbolic Computation and Formal Languages) and cs.MS (Mathematical Software) are also possible sub-categories. Finally, the application of the algorithms to electrostatic particle-in-cell codes suggests that cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science) is a possible sub-category.
